about: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.
detail_abilities: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.

name: Eldegoss
about: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.
detail_abilities: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.

name: Wooloo
about: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.
detail_abilities: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Dubwool
about: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Chewtle
about: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.
detail_abilities: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Drednaw
about: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.
detail_abilities: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Yamper
about: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
detail_abilities: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.

name: Boltund
about: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Rolycoly
about: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
detail_abilities: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.

name: Carkol
about: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
detail_abilities: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Coalossal
about: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.
detail_abilities: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Applin
about: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.
detail_abilities: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

name: Flapple
about: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.
detail_abilities: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

name: Appletun
about: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.
detail_abilities: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

name: Silicobra
about: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Sandaconda
about: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Cramorant
about: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.
detail_abilities: When the Pokémon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack.

name: Arrokuda
about: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.
detail_abilities: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Barraskewda
about: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.
detail_abilities: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

name: Toxel
about: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

name: Toxtricity
about: It has an electrical organ on its chest. While generating electricity, it fills its surroundings with what sounds like the strumming of a bass guitar.
detail_abilities: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Sizzlipede
about: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
detail_abilities: Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.

name: Centiskorch
about: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.
detail_abilities: Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.

name: Clobbopus
about: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.
detail_abilities: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

name: Grapploct
about: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
detail_abilities: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

name: Sinistea
about: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.
detail_abilities: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

name: Polteageist
about: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.
detail_abilities: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

name: Hatenna
about: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

name: Hattrem
about: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

name: Hatterene
about: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.

name: Impidimp
about: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.
detail_abilities: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

name: Morgrem
about: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.
detail_abilities: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

name: Grimmsnarl
about: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.
detail_abilities: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.

name: Obstagoon
about: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
detail_abilities: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.

name: Perrserker
about: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.
detail_abilities: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Cursola
about: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
detail_abilities: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

name: Sirfetch’d
about: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Mr. Rime
about: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
detail_abilities: Raises evasiveness if the Pokémon is confused.

name: Runerigus
about: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

name: Milcery
about: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
detail_abilities: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.

name: Alcremie
about: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.
detail_abilities: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.

name: Falinks
about: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.
detail_abilities: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Pincurchin
about: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves.  Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves,  it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Snom
about: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.
detail_abilities: This Pokémon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.

name: Frosmoth
about: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.
detail_abilities: This Pokémon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.

name: Stonjourner
about: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
detail_abilities: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.

name: Eiscue
about: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon's ice head can take a physical attack as a substitute, but the attack also changes the Pokémon's appearance. The ice will be restored when it hails.

name: Indeedee
about: They diligently serve people and Pokémon so they can gather feelings of gratitude. The females are particularly good at babysitting.
detail_abilities: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.

name: Morpeko
about: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of each turn.

name: Cufant
about: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.
detail_abilities: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.

name: Copperajah
about: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.
detail_abilities: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.

name: Dracozolt
about: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.
detail_abilities: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Arctozolt
about: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

name: Dracovish
about: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.
detail_abilities: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Arctovish
about: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.
detail_abilities: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Duraludon
about: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
detail_abilities: Halves the Pokémon's weight.

name: Dreepy
about: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.
detail_abilities: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

name: Drakloak
about: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.
detail_abilities: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

name: Dragapult
about: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.
detail_abilities: Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.

name: Zacian
about: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.
detail_abilities: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Zamazenta
about: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
detail_abilities: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Eternatus
about: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
detail_abilities: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

name: Kubfu
about: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
detail_abilities: The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

name: Urshifu
about: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.
detail_abilities:
If the Pokémon uses moves that make direct contact,
it can attack the target even if the target protects itself.

name: Zarude
about:
Once the vines on Zarude's body tear off, they
become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants
of the forest grow.
detail_abilities: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.
